question:
The number of older people is increasing. Some people think it will cause problem to their countries; others believe that this group is important to the society. 
Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
text: Aged population is rising rapidly in many countries. Although a section of society advocates that older people are important for the development of the country, I, however, hold the view that it creates several issues in their countries.

On the one hand, proponents of former view consider that retired persons are assets to their homelands. The reason could be that they are an ultimate source of knowledge because of their vast life experience. They can provide valuable suggestions in critical decision making, leading to savings of time and money. For instance, if they are not working and earning, can voluntarily guide young learners as their teachers in selecting courses. This way, they can contribute in the society’s development up to some extent.

On the other hand, I side with those who argue that rise in number of older people causes burden on state exchequer. The reason behind that is they have no source of income and are not able to work because of their age. In most countries, states provide old age pension, health insurance, and old age shelter for their retired population which in return providing nothing to state. Another significant cause is that shortage of young manpower for industries due to rise in old age people, leading to decline in industrial output. Governments have to import various utilities to fulfill their requirements, making loss of foreign currency deposits. Therefore, aging population leads to weakening the economic conditions of many nations.

In conclusion, although retired people can provide guidance, however, governments have to spend a lot on providing many amenities to them which leads to economic crisis. Therefore, I maintain that it puts pressure on the financial condition of the nation.
